intro: Zeuxine nervosa, commonly known as the veiny zigzag flower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many species with showy, often blue or purple flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a distinct veining pattern, contributing to its common name. Zeuxine nervosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or stream banks.
